title: Verify Event Sync do not send Master Events explicitly within a <performance> element in the response
custom_preconds: Turn Off Sync for supplier(NGCS) in Maintenance Site

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch the application using the URL :
2. Navigate to Event Administration and create an Event(Cardinal Supplier)
3. Navigate to Package List Administration and create a package list with master event and include above event
4. Navigate to Package Administration and create a package and include above package list
5. Manually Perf accept the package in Maintenance Site(NGCS_CARDS_MLB)
6. Verify Find Performance Call in Logs
7. Navigate to Package Administration, select the package created above and update any value
8. Turn On Sync for supplier(NGCS) in Maintenance Site
9. Verify Event Sync Find Performance Call at the next run time set for the supplier 
10. Turn On Acceptance for supplier(NGCS) in Maintenance Site
11. Repeat Steps 2 to 4
12. Verify Auto Accept Find Performance Call at the next run time set for the supplier
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The site should be launched successfully
2. Event should be created successfully
3. Package List should be created successfully
4. Package should be created successfully
5. Perf Accept should be successful
6. Master Event should not be passed explicitly within a <performance> element in the response.
Master Event will be returned with a <package_performance> element, nested within a <performance> element.
7. Changes should be saved successfully
8. 
9. Master Event should not be passed explicitly within a <performance> element in the response.
Master Event will be returned with a <package_performance> element, nested within a <performance> element.
10. 
11. Master Package should be created successfully
12. Master Event should not be passed explicitly within a <performance> element in the response.
Master Event will be returned with a <package_performance> element, nested within a <performance> element.

title: Verify that the user is unable to lock seats for half package which are already blocked by another user for Full Package

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Pre-requsite:
Create a Full and Half packages and add the Half package to the Master Event Blocking tab
2. Launch PV application  and login as user U1
load seat map for Full package
3. Login as User U2: load seat map for Half package and select (not lock) some seats
4. Login as user1: select and lock the same seats selected by user2 (but for fullPkgA)
n the cart, use a credit card as payment **use card that is pre-auth but will fail at check-out
checkout --> check out should fail due to the credit card
5. Login as user2: lock the pre-selected seats
6. Verify that the user is able to lock seats or the package
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. User should be able to login
3. User should be able to login and should select the seats
4. Checkout should fail
5. lock the seats
6. user2 should not be able to lock; seats are still blocked by user1

title: Verify if the Reapply blocking create unique constraint error

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV with valid credentials
2. Create 3 package event lists with a master  event. 
Put Event list status as Unavailable
Select blocking hold code as BLOCK-Blocked  seats
3. Preparation - Get lists in Unavailable Status 
Change status on all Package Event Lists (PEL) from master/available to unavailable.
> Select 1st PEL. 
> Change status. 
> Apply changes. Repeat for next PEL.
4. 4.[Remove any existing Blocking Codes 
Remove currently defined master events
> Select 1st PEL. 
> Click on master event blocking tab.
> Click remove all to remove currently defined master events from list. 
> Screen draws red line through elements. 
> Apply changes. Repeat for next PEL. 
Preview the Unblock Removed Master Events Action
> Click the box next to Unblock Removed Master Events Action
> Click PREVIEW
> Review the info in the pop-up and close.
> Note, Preview will only calculate after Remove X and Apply changes. Cannot preview if the master event is still shown in crossed out red text. 
Run the Unblock Removed Master Events Action
> Click the box next to Unblock Removed Master Events Action
> Click REAPPLY BLOCKING
> After successful message, re-run the Preview step above and confirm now 0 blocks to remove.
Wait for all background transaction threads to complete - suggest 10 minutes from successful remove green message.
5. 5.[ Apply blocking codes 
Note** Both sets of steps in this area are required. You need to add the master associations to all lists first. Then you need to go through the lists again to apply the blocking based on the new associations. This process is also used when adding a new package into a set of packages that have already been on sale.
Add correct master events
> Call up 1st PEL.
> Click on master event blocking tab. 
> Add correct master events. 
> Apply changes. Repeat for next PEL. 
Reapply blocking
> Select 1st PEL. 
> Select all master events in list. 
> Click Preview. Verify Seats to Block is greater than 0 and expected number in pop-up.
> Close the pop-up, master events will still be selected.
> DoubleClick Reapply Blocking. Get Master Event Blocking was successful green message. 
> While master events still selected, click Preview again. Seats to Block should now be 0
> Repeat the above for the next PEL. 
Note: There was a time lapse between the last update and a successful test. Give time for the inventory to update in the back end.
Verify no error is displayed
6. Update the 3 event list to master only status
7. Verify that no errors ar displayed
8. Verify if duplicate records exist:
select its.seat_id, its.source_hold_code_id, its.target_hold_code_id, 
                its.event_id, its.blocking_event_id,
                count(its.inventory_transaction_seat_id)
        FROM inventory_transaction it, inventory_transaction_seat its
        WHERE it.inventory_trxn_type_code = 'MB'
                AND it.inventory_transaction_id = its.inventory_transaction_id
                AND its.in_active_block_date is null
--              for the duplicate columns seat_id, source_hold_code_id, target_hold_code_id, event_id, blocking_event_id must be same
        group by its.seat_id, its.source_hold_code_id, its.target_hold_code_id, 
                its.event_id, its.blocking_event_id     
        having count(its.inventory_transaction_seat_id) >= 2
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login should be successfull
2. Package event lists should be created
3. 
4. The description should be updated successfuly
5. Description should be successfully updated
6. Status of event lists should be updated
7. Error should not be displayed
8. The duplicate records should not exist

title: Verify Master event hold code equivalence during release when the source master event id is less than any of constituent event ids of the master event package lists

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. note: Built the set-up in the specified order below.
1. First create Package Event Lists (PEL_Full, PEL_HalfA, PEL_HalfB, PEL_Qrtr1, PEL_Qrtr2) - create them with Master event in an Unavailable status
2. Create Packages (P_Full, P_HalfA, P_HalfB, P_Qrtr1, P_Qrtr2) - associate the Event List, leave package in Off Sale status
3. Create Single Events (EV1, EV2, EV3, EV4, EV5, EV6, EV7, EV8) - create them in On Sale status
4. Then associate the events to the PELs, and set to Available status
5. Then set Packages to On Sale status
2. 6. Make the status of all Event Lists to 'Unavailable'
7. Assign Master Event Holds - Navigate to Package Event List > Master Event Blocking tab, add  Package Event Lists.
8. Assign Master Event Blocking - Navigate to Package Event List > Master Event Holds tab, add Package Event Lists.
9. Make the status of Event Lists to 'Available'
3. 10. For the PELs, set Hold Code Return/Release Behavior as 'User Selectable Hold Code' - Navigate to Package Event List > Package List Access
11. Set Blocking Hold Code for all the Master Events (in Package Event Lists)
4. Login to the PV application using valid credentials.
5. 1. Navigate to Ticket Sales
2. Select P_Full Package
3. Select Hold Code A
4. Complete Reservation Transaction
6. 1. Navigate to Order View details in Ticket Services
2. Select Release from the 'Select Action' drop down
3. Select all the tickets
4. Click on Apply Action
7. 1. Select Payment Method
2. Select the same Hold Code A from User Selectable Hold Code drop down List
3. Click on Check Out
8. 1. Navigate to Ticket Sales
2. Select P_Full Package
3. Select Hold Code A
4. Complete Reservation Transaction
9. 1. Navigate to Order View details in Ticket Services
2. Select Release from the 'Select Action' drop down
3. Select all the tickets
4. Click on Apply Action
10. 1. Select Payment Method
2. Select another Hold Code B from User Selectable Hold Code drop down List
3. Click on Check Out
11. Verify No Error Displayed while attempting to change the hold code during the release.
12. Repeat the steps 8 to 11 for any other packages (say P_HalfA and P_Qrtr2)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. User should able to build PELs and Packages as follows:
P_Full -- PEL_Full -- EV1 to EV8
P_HalfA -- PEL_HalfA -- EV1 to EV4
P_HalfB -- PEL_HalfB -- EV5 to EV8
P_Qrtr1-- PEL_Qrtr1 -- EV1 & Ev5
P_Qrtr2 -- PEL_Qrtr2 -- EV2 & Ev8
2. User should able to set up both Master Event Blocking and Master Event Holds associations as follows:
Full -- HalfA, HalfB, Qrtr1, Qrtr2
HalfA -- Full, Qrtr1, Qrtr2
HalfB -- Full, Qrtr1, Qrtr2
Qrtr1 -- Full, HalfA, HalfB
Qrtr2 -- Full, HalfA, HalfB
3. User should able to set Hold Code Return/Release Behavior as 'User Selectable Hold Code'
4. User logged in successfully.
5. User should able to complete Reservation Transaction for the selected Package
6. User should abe to select tickets for Release.
Ticket cart should be displayed.
7. User should able to select Hold Code from drop Down and check out successfuly
8. User should able to complete Reservation Transaction for the selected Package
9. User should abe to select tickets for Release.
Ticket cart should be displayed.
10. User should able to select Hold Code from drop Down and check out successfully
11. The Selected Hold code should be updated Successfully and the release transaction should be completed successfully

[The Following Error Should not display in the Cart Page:
Hold Code Management transaction could not be completed because hold code could not be propagated to seats in an equivalent Master Event PEL_Full of Package List PEL_Full]
12. The selected Hold code should be updated successfully and the release transaction should be completed successfully with out any error.

title: Verify whether master event expansion skips any orders upon restarting after it is stopped with some orders yet to be processed

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application using the link provided
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Create a package that has only one master only event list
2.Set up large number of orders (100 or more) for this package for the same user/Agency

[This can be done by performing Rollover]

[Note the Target User, Target Agency selected for Rollover]
4. 1.Create a new event for the same venue as that of the package mentioned above
2.Navigate to Package Event List Administartion
3.select the master only event list mentioned above
4.Navigate to Events tab
5.Include the event craeted above to this event list
5. 1.Navigate to User Management portal
2.Select the Target user selected for Rollover
3.Unmap the Target Agency(of Rollover) from this user 
4.Navigate back to Master Event Expansion utility
5.Search for the master event mentioned above
6.Click the Expand option
7.Navigate to Expansion tab
8.Stop the Expansion
9.Note the '# To Process' and '# Processed' values
6. 1.Navigate to User Management portal
2.Select the user mentioned above
3.Map the Agency mentioned above to this user
4.Navigate back to Master Event Expansion utility
5.Navigate to "Expansion: tab
6.Click the icon to Restart the expansion process
7.Wait for some time and search for the master event in the Expansion' tab
7. 1.Navigate to Utilities portal
2.Select the option 'Expand' froom the drop down provided
3.Select the master only event list mentioned above
4.Validate this master only event list.
5.Resolve the errors (if any) that is displayed in the Validation Report
8. 1.Navigate to Reports portal
2.Select the Order Summary Report (category: Ticket Sales, sub category: Order Summaries)
3.Select the Order Summary Report
4.Generate the Order Summary Report for the constituent event which was added to master event list (Give a Transaction date Range that covers the date of Rollover performed earlier)
4.Note the Order Count for thsi Report
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched successfully
2. Login should be successfull
3. A package with master only event list should be available with large number of orders (100 or more)
4. Constituent event should be added to this event list
5. Expansion process should be stopped.

None of the orders should get processed. The '# Processed' count should be zero.
6. Expansion process should be completed successfully.

All the order should be processed successfully. None of the orders should get skipped.

The '# Processed' value should be the same as the '# To Process' value noted in previous step
7. The master event should get validated.

Errors displayed in validation report(if any) should get resolved
8. Order Summary Report should get generted successfully.

The Order count should be the '# Processed' orders during master event expansion.
